GaliciaClass   
Gain in depth knowledge of the gastronomy, terroir, varietals and wine-making styles of Galicia, Spain. Galicia is also known as “Green Spain,” an area much more akin to the terrain and weather of Ireland, than what we think of as traditional Spain. With a unique culture and rich history, Galicia is Spain’s leading area for fine White Wine production, making some of the most unique White Wines of the world, including the famous Albarinos of Rias Baixas. This tasting will focus solely on these White Wines and their food pairing abilities.

 

The style of these wine courses is designed for the beginner looking to become a professional, or an enthusiast looking to gain more knowledge and wine tasting experience. No one is born with the ability to decipher particular aromas and flavors in wine – it can only come with lots of practice, and student of these wine courses will gain great training in palate development. We discuss topics beyond the typical “abc’s,” often focusing on how to describe and understand unfamiliar wines and regions. Students of the wine class will gain experience in wine terminology, wine tasting and evaluation, wine-making techniques and styles, regions of the world, effects of climate and weather on vineyards, and over-all , interesting facts and knowledge about the wines of the world.

Typical Wine Class Schedule  – 1 ½ - 2 hours in length.

3:30pm – Class starts promptly. begin lecture, usually 30-45 minutes in length

4:15pm – wine tasting of 7-10 wines, corresponding to subject of class

5:00pm – dismiss

Cost: $30 all inclusive
